text.value:
When you multiply a positive number with a negative number according to arithmetic rules, the sign of the result will be negative. This is because:

- Positive × Positive = Positive
- Negative × Negative = Positive
- Positive × Negative = Negative
- Negative × Positive = Negative

So, multiplying a positive number by a negative number (or a negative number by a positive number) always results in a negative product.
When you multiply a positive number with a negative number, what is the sign of the result according to the arithmetic rules?
